modules.core_focus: This module explores Al and ML as design materials, investigating the potentials and challenges of Al techniques in an interaction design and creative context.
modules.learning_qualification_objectives:

modules.prerequisites: OS_01 Introduction to Software Engineering, OS_02 Introduction to Design, OS_03 Introduction to Business Management & Entrepreneurship, OS_05 Application of Project-Based Learning Methods
modules.core_focus: This module aims to address these questions by providing a general, introductory overview of the history of design, including influential design movements. The central idea is that studying the past enables us to better understand our present and predict possible futures.
learning_goals: Gain a comprehensive understanding of the historical evolution of design styles, movements, and influential designers.
Analyze the impact of design history on contemporary visual culture and its relevance in shaping the future of design.
modules.learning_qualification_objectives:
Students who successfully pass this module are able to:

Understand influential designers and important historical, theoretical, social, and ethical frameworks in design
Apply this knowledge to reflect on their own work as well as the work of others
Utilize a future-oriented perspective in design by incorporating important historical, social, and ethical aspects and up-to-date research and addressing these topics in complex conceptual and visual work

modules.title_and_version: DS_01 Composition Module Handbook Version: DS_01_v4
modules.prerequisites: OS_01 Introduction to Software Engineering, OS_02 Introduction to Design, OS_03 Introduction to Business Management & Entrepreneurship, OS_05 Application of Project-Based Learning Methods
modules.core_focus: The students learn and practice the use of color, contrast, shapes, and proportions according to the gestalt principles and drawing sessions. Photography is used to further apply and practice. Students learn the fundamentals of photography, i.e., image composition, lighting and flash, aperture and exposure, the basic chemical process of b/w photography, basics of digital photography. Students will be using the medium of photography as an expressive and experimental tool.
modules.technical_skills: Fundamentals of photography, i.e., image composition, lighting and flash, aperture and exposure, the basic chemical process of b/w photography, basics of digital photography.
learning_goals: Understand how to use rules of aesthetics in your design practice
Understand how to create colors palettes
Understand and apply the gestalt principles
Understand the composition of visual design work
Understand the use of light, shadows, and contrast
Understand how to focus on certain elements with a visual language
Create sets of visual work in diverse areas to apply the points mentioned above
Critically reflect on aesthetics in a constructive way
Present visual work in a professional way
modules.learning_qualification_objectives:
Students who successfully pass this module are able to:
Understand the gestalt principles and interpret images accordingly
Create diverse assets with different techniques that adhere to the gestalt principles
Demonstrate understanding of image composition by developing experimental techniques, taking the nature of visual practice into account

modules.prerequisites: OS_01 Introduction to Software Engineering, OS_02 Introduction to Design, OS_03 Introduction to Business Management & Entrepreneurship, OS_05 Application of Project-Based Learning Methods
modules.core_focus: Generative Design is a design exploration process for personal expression. The iterative writing and modification of software code combines applied design with art, as it is done in an experimental and playful way. The goal is to build awareness of the creational process of setting initial parameters that lead to an (intended) computer-generated output, and consequently to novel forms of visual and interactive communication for engaging experiences.
modules.technical_skills: learning the coding basics in the Processing IDE, various graphing libraries, such as the ControlP5 will be used. In this class we will use p5.js and webGl to develop an online graphic animation system that offers a variety of complex and often non-repeating patterns. We will be able to create evolving design that can react to different information, such as weather data, sound frequency or gesture tracking. We will also use the software touchDesigner to create immersive digital spaces that can lead to new and impactful artworks and experiences.
modules.learning_qualification_objectives:
Students who successfully pass this module are able to:
Understand Generative Design, e.g. creating Sketches and multi-document Sketches, different renderers to create images, PDFs, animation, applications, and web interfaces
Understand functions and libraries in this context: video, sound, PDF Export and Serial as well as important third-party libraries and third-party input devices

modules.prerequisites: OS_01 Introduction to Software Engineering, OS_02 Introduction to Design, OS_03 Introduction to Business Management & Entrepreneurship, OS_05 Application of Project-Based Learning Methods
modules.core_focus: Students who study this module will be provided with an introduction to human-centered design, field studies, gathering data and formulating insights. Interaction designers are designers of interactions and this is the expertise and focus they bring to a team. As such, this module introduces notions of interactivity and raises awareness about users' motivations, needs, desires, fears, and their context. This module introduces the basics of what a design methodology is and how this can be used to guide projects. This module looks into design field research (or field studies) which includes gathering insights (data) about users through observation techniques, conducting interviews, implementing cultural probes, among other methods. It is a practical module so students are expected to demonstrate a body of work that includes experiments and documentation.
learning_goals: Investigate a topic through the use of a primary research method (inc. the use of secondary sources)
Analyze gathered data through contextually relevant methods/approaches
Synthesize information from multiple perspectives to generate topic-relevant insights
Present work in a creative, coherent, and concise manner (which includes adherence to the word count, proper referencing and citation and the use of contextually located images).

Students who successfully pass this module are able to:
• Investigate a topic through the use of a primary research method
• Analyze gathered data through contextually relevant methods/approaches

modules.prerequisites: OS_01 Introduction to Software Engineering, OS_02 Introduction to Design, OS_03 Introduction to Business Management & Entrepreneurship, OS_05 Application of Project-Based Learning Methods
modules.core_focus: This module explores the new and emerging role for design in industry and its contribution to product innovation and value proposition. It provides students with an overview of how to determine what to make and do, why to do it, and how to innovate contextually, both immediately and over the long-term. This further enables students to create meaningful products-services with character-by considering relevant touch-points. Thereby students learn techniques like market and brand analyses, future scenarios, technology forecasting and roadmapping as drivers for strategic design.
modules.learning_qualification_objectives:
Students who successfully pass this module are able to:
• Identify and utilize a range of methods to assist in the strategic development of your project (e.g., stakeholder mapping, future scenarios, technology forecasting, storyboarding, user stories, etc.) •
Develop clear avenues for 'creative outcome' development (e.g., design product, service, experience, analog object, loT, etc.) Create project development milestones and/or time plans that are contextually appropriate and acknowledge local/global developments (e.g., technological, political, social)
Communicate project work in a creative, coherent, and concise manner

modules.title_and_version: DS_19 Responsive Design Module Handbook Version: DS_19_v4
modules.prerequisites: OS_01 — Introduction to Software Engineering, OS_02 — Introduction to Design, OS_03 — Introduction to Business Management & Entrepreneurship, OS_05 — Application of Project-Based Learning Methods
modules.core_focus: This module explores the theoretical, design-related, and technical aspects of responsive web design (abbreviated RWD in the text below). Students will learn about the history of web design and its evolution to responsive design. Using contemporary tools and methods, students will then learn how to create basic, intermediate or advanced web designs and / or HTML / CSS implementations based on responsive web design criteria and principles.
modules.learning_qualification_objectives: Students who successfully pass this module are able to: Understand how to think creatively in design, technology, and user needs in regard to a responsive website; Apply creative thinking to design a website, produce a screen design, and/or implement these in HTML/CSS; Understand placement, layout techniques, and typography and employ their knowledge on a project of their choice; Evaluate their work and the work of others regarding responsive design

modules.core_focus: Services are ubiquitous and their design utilises a people-centered design process that is used by designers and organisations in order to develop better services. Service Design adds value for users by exploring, understanding, and improving their experiences across the various stages of service and for service providers by enhancing their back-end operations.

modules.title_and_version: DS_23 Visual Interface Design Module Handbook Version: DS_23_v4
modules.prerequisites: OS_01 Introduction to Software Engineering, OS_02 Introduction to Design, OS_03 Introduction to Business Management & Entrepreneurship, OS_05 Application of Project-Based Learning Methods
modules.core_focus: This module sheds light on the foundational knowledge for designing user visual interfaces. It addresses how we humans perceive visual interfaces, and how designers apply this knowledge to create user interfaces in creative and professional ways. With a user-centred and inclusive perspective, the module covers the design process that includes modelling users' needs, information architecture, sketching and wireframes, design standards, usability, evaluation with users and design systems.
learning_goals: Analyse users' needs by applying critical thinking to models such as users' stories, personas, empathy model, etc.
Propose an Information Architecture (IA) that aligns with users' information needs, IA principles, and the users' expectations on the content organization and labels
Formulate design ideas with sketches
Design wireframes and high-fidelity prototypes
Utilize design patterns, style guides and design systems to ensure consistency across the design
modules.learning_qualification_objectives:
Students who successfully pass this module are able to:
Analyze users' needs by applying critical thinking to models such as users' stories, personas, empathy model, etc.
Propose an Information Architecture (IA) that aligns with users' information needs, IA principles, and the users' expectations on the content organization and labels
Formulate design ideas with sketches
Design wireframes and high-fidelity prototypes
Justify design decisions by referencing design principles, heuristics, accessibility guidelines and ethical considerations, such as avoiding dark patterns
